As people grow older, their bodies change in many ways. This is called aging. Our cells get older and start to break down. Our skin wrinkles and gets thinner. Our muscles get weaker. We may lose some of our hair. Some people's teeth start to fall out. Our bodies start to have a harder time fixing themselves when we get sick or hurt. We may need to take medicine or go to the doctor more often.

We can still learn new things, read, and have fun with our friends and family. Aging is a natural part of life.

Then, as adults, their growth slows down, and their bodies start to get weaker. Older adults may have gray hair, wrinkles, and aches in their bones. Their hearts may beat more slowly.
